Posted By: allmighty_abacus (9/7/2010 9:47:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Am I the only one who finds the flavor text awesome?  
  
Anyway, back to the effect. In burn, nothing is worse than overextending yourself. If you spend all of your mana on something else, what will you do for spot removal? That's where this thing shines; it gives you the element of surprise. That's why it's so great.   
Although, I'd have to say the [Elvish Spirit Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Spirit Guide) was better than it in its time. It tricked people into alpha striking with a fog in-hand. This does not help in the aforementioned situation.
posts.html:
Am I the only one who finds the flavor text awesome?

Anyway, back to the effect. In burn, nothing is worse than overextending yourself. If you spend all of your mana on something else, what will you do for spot removal? That's where this thing shines; it gives you the element of surprise. That's why it's so great.
Although, I'd have to say the Elvish Spirit Guide was better than it in its time. It tricked people into alpha striking with a fog in-hand. This does not help in the aforementioned situation.

Posted By: DrZygfryd (8/3/2010 4:04:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really can't believe this costs only $0.10...  
  
ridiculously awesome card. I use this in my Naya Zoo to accelerate. Once I even got [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf) out on turn two which cascaded into [Woolly Thoctar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Woolly Thoctar). It was pretty much game from there.  
  
This should be an auto-include for any red deck. Being able to drop things like [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) with no mana open can be ridiculously surprising (not to mention fun :) )
posts.html:
